How to get rid of flies, according to experts

The best way to get rid of flies and other flying insects is by regularly cleaning areas that are susceptible to attracting them, according to Ian Williams, technical manager at extermination services company Orkin. “Proper waste management and sanitation is the single most effective way to keep flies and fruit flies out of a home,” he says. Taking out the trash frequently and rinsing out beverage containers can also go a long way in preventing flies from entering your home.
You can also consider using some of the top-rated products below — they all have at least a 4-star average rating from 500 reviews or more on Amazon.
Want more from NBC Select? Sign up for our newsletter, The Selection, and shop smarter.
How I picked the best products for getting rid of flies, mosquitoes, gnats and other insects

There are several key factors to consider when selecting the most effective products for removing flies from your home, including the type of insect and fragrance. Here are some things I kept in mind when making this list:

Insect type: There are different types of flying insects, and while you can deal with many of them in similar ways, some require alternative methods for effective removal. Fruit flies, for example, are attracted to very sweet, acidic and fragrant ingredients, like apple cider vinegar.

Insect type: There are different types of flying insects, and while you can deal with many of them in similar ways, some require alternative methods for effective removal. Fruit flies, for example, are attracted to very sweet, acidic and fragrant ingredients, like apple cider vinegar.

Environment: Drain flies thrive mostly in damp, enclosed environments, as their name implies, while mosquitoes and house flies are attracted to areas with a lot of filth or decaying organic matter (trash), according to Gil Bloom, president of pest control company Standard Pest Management. My list caters to a range of environments.

Environment: Drain flies thrive mostly in damp, enclosed environments, as their name implies, while mosquitoes and house flies are attracted to areas with a lot of filth or decaying organic matter (trash), according to Gil Bloom, president of pest control company Standard Pest Management. My list caters to a range of environments.

It contains a mixture of sodium lauryl sulfate, malic acid, ethyl lactate, water and vinegar. The smell of the apple cider vinegar acts like a magnet for flies. Additionally, Delah Gomasi, managing director and CEO of cleaning services company MaidForYou, highly recommends using both apple cider vinegar and a bit of dish soap for getting rid of fruit flies. “The main reason a mixture of apple cider vinegar and dish soap works so well in eradicating fruit flies is because the apple cider vinegar attracts the fruit flies whilst the dish soap traps them in the mixture,” he says.

They expand into a long spiraled ribbon, which  you can attach to a wall, windowsill or door, according to the brand. All you have to do is place in an area that gets a good amount of natural light, which is more likely to attract flies and other pests.
What attracts flies in the home?

There are a few common causes for flies around the home, according to our experts. While there are a few different types of flies, in addition to other flying insects that are often confused for one another, like mosquitoes and gnats, many of them are typically caused by the following factors:

Fruit and sugar: Both fruit flies and house flies, which are categorized as “filth flies,” are extremely attracted to the smell of fruit, according to Bloom.  “In the home, they are typically introduced as eggs on fruit and produce which then emerge once fermentation starts,” he says. “You can see this relationship if you look at fruit stands.” This problem arises when the fruit is left out, unwashed, overripe and/or rotting in a trash, fridge or cabinet or on a countertop. Additionally, fruit flies gravitate toward sugar substances like soda, fruit juice and candy.

Fermentation: Similarly, fruit flies are often attracted to the smell of fermented foods and drinks, such as beer, wine, kombucha, yogurt, cheese and bread. While you keep these items in the fridge, things like small spills or crumbs left on the counter can attract flies. Plus, when you throw these items out, they can still attract flies due to residual matter. This is why Bloom recommends regularly rinsing out containers, cans and bottles before throwing them out to prevent flies.

Decaying matter and filth: Other types of filth flies, such as the house fly, may gravitate towards fruit, but they’re also attracted to dirtier materials, according to Bloom. This includes leaking drains, dirty mops, compost and pet litter.  This could also include bits of food sitting in your garbage disposal.

Windows and weather: Lastly, leaving windows and doors open, even for a few seconds, gives flies the easiest entry into your home. That said, you may also notice an increase in flying insects like flies, fruit flies, mosquitoes and fungus gnats during late spring and throughout summer, according to Williams. “Flies and fruit flies have more access to food sources in the warmer months, as they’re attracted to rotting produce that is more abundant this time of year,” he says. In other words, a more humid environment makes it easier for flies to survive and reproduce.

title: These products will help keep your hair healthy while you sleep
summary: I asked hairstylists for the best products for preventing breakage, tangling and frizz while you sleep, including hair serums, silk pillowcases, hair bonnets and more from brands like Silk, Olaplex and Mielle Organics.
story: Breakage, tangling, frizziness — as much as I love sleep, sometimes the damage it does to my hair almost makes it feel like a chore. However, over the years I’ve learned that with the right products and accessories, protecting your hair at night doesn’t have to be such a hassle. But which products work best? Do you need a hair treatment in your night routine? And are satin pillowcases really worth it?

To find out about all this and more, I spoke to Tina Malhotra, a professional hairstylist at Mia Wagner Salon in New York City, and Bridgette Hill, a professional stylist and certified trichologist, who gave me advice on how best to protect your hair at night and recommendations to keep in mind.

Frequently asked questions

Anytime our hair fibers are pressed against a surface, there’s a chance of the fibers becoming stressed via pulling or tangling from our head movements, says Hill. In addition to breakage caused by rough fibers from your pillow or sleep accessories, Malhotra says sleeping with wet hair can also cause damage, since wet hair is weaker and more prone to breakage. Along with breakage, you’ll wake up to a tangled mess that may require more heat and styling to fix, she says. To avoid this, she recommends fully drying your hair at night and sleeping on a smooth, high-quality pillowcase — preferably silk or satin, like the options I listed above.

Yes; although Hill cautions that all hair textures risk unwanted friction and tension, factors like your hair’s porosity, your cleansing routine, scalp hydration and more can impact what areas of concern you should focus on. Here’s some general advice Malhotra has for different hair types:

Straight hair concerns typically center on greasiness and oiliness, along with losing volume, she says. Fine, straight hair is also more prone to tangling, knotting and matting. To combat this, she suggests avoiding heavy overnight hair products, like oils or creams, since they can encourage oil production and greasiness. “Using a silk pillowcase to reduce friction can help with overall hair health and stopping breakage,” she says. Putting your hair in loose braids can also help you to avoid morning knots and keep your hair voluminous overnight.Wavy, curly and natural hair types all run the risk of getting frizzy overnight, for which Malhotra suggests using a light leave-in conditioner. “[It] can keep hair hydrated while you sleep and help keep the shape of the waves, [which reduces] frizz,’ she says.

Straight hair concerns typically center on greasiness and oiliness, along with losing volume, she says. Fine, straight hair is also more prone to tangling, knotting and matting. To combat this, she suggests avoiding heavy overnight hair products, like oils or creams, since they can encourage oil production and greasiness. “Using a silk pillowcase to reduce friction can help with overall hair health and stopping breakage,” she says. Putting your hair in loose braids can also help you to avoid morning knots and keep your hair voluminous overnight.

Wavy, curly and natural hair types all run the risk of getting frizzy overnight, for which Malhotra suggests using a light leave-in conditioner. “[It] can keep hair hydrated while you sleep and help keep the shape of the waves, [which reduces] frizz,’ she says.
Once again, the best hairstyle for sleeping will depend on your hair type and current style. However, here are a few tips Malhotra and Hill suggest keeping in mind:

For wavy and long hair, Malhotra suggests using a satin scrunchie or hair accessory to pull the hair into a high ponytail, a loose high bun, or a loose braid (this will help avoid unwanted creases and tangling, and make it easier to style the next morning).Fine or short hair tends to do well when kept down at night, since it reduces pulling/tension on the scalp, while thick, textured hair would benefit from sleeping in two braids to minimize tangles, says Hill.If you’re putting your hair up, avoid any styles that may pull your hair too tightly, since it’ll lead to increased breakage. For tightly coiled or curly hair, Hill recommends gathering the hair to the crowd of your head with a silk scarf (also known as “pineappling”).

Fine or short hair tends to do well when kept down at night, since it reduces pulling/tension on the scalp, while thick, textured hair would benefit from sleeping in two braids to minimize tangles, says Hill.

Tina Malhotra is a hair colorist and stylist at Mia Wagner Salon in New York City.Bridgette Hill is a professional stylist and certified trichologist, with expertise in scalp health and wellness.

Why trust NBC Select?

I am an associate SEO reporter for NBC Select, covering skin care, wellness, home and kitchen and more. For this story, I spoke to hair care professionals about the best ways to protect your hair at night, including product recommendations and advice on how to shop for your own. I also included my favorite ways to protect my hair at night, including my favorite durags, silk bonnets and more.
Catch up on NBC Select’s in-depth coverage of tech and tools, wellness and more, and follow us on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and TikTok to stay up to date.

title: 3 deputies killed in explosion at Los Angeles County sheriff's training facility
summary: Three veteran Los Angeles County sheriff's deputies who specialize in arson and explosives investigations were killed when military-style ordnance detonated at a training facility on Friday morning, authorities said
story: Three veteran Los Angeles County sheriff's deputies who specialize in arson and explosives investigations were killed when military-style ordnance detonated at a training facility on Friday morning, authorities said.

The department picked up two explosives overnight in the L.A. County community of Lakewood and had taken them back to the department's training facility in East L.A., law enforcement sources told NBC News.
One of those two military-style devices exploded, killing the three deputies.

The explosives specialists involved in Friday's accident had assisted police in Santa Monica on Thursday, and investigators were getting a warrant to go search that location — but it remained unclear if there was any connection, a department spokesperson said. Lakewood is 22 miles southeast of Santa Monica.
Friday was the deadliest day in more than a century and a half of department history, Sheriff Robert Luna said.
“This is, unfortunately, the largest loss of life for us as the L.A. County Sheriff’s Department since 1857," he said.

Los Angeles County firefighters were dispatched at 7:27 a.m. PT for an explosion by 1000 N. Eastern Ave. in East L.A., which is near the sheriff department's Eugene Biscailuz Regional Training Academy, 5 miles east of L.A. City Hall, officials said.

The dead were identified as Detective Joshua Kelley-Eklund, Detective Victor Lemus and Detective William Osborn, who were all on the Special Enforcement Bureau’s Arson Explosives Detail. Luna said they had 74 years of collective experience on the force.

"I’ve heard over and over the word 'elite' being used. I think sometime that that term gets overused. But if you’re familiar with  our Special Enforcement Bureau, they’re the best of the best," Luna said. "They are fantastic experts, and unfortunately I lost three of them today."
Luna told reporters the investigation has just started so the cause is still not known.
"The thoughts of all Angelenos are with all of those impacted by this blast," L.A. Mayor Karen Bass said in a statement.
California Gov. Gavin Newsom said, "This is a heartbreaking day for California."
The FBI and the federal Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives' National Response Team are assisting in the investigation.
LAPD Chief Jim McDonnell pledged his bomb squad, SWAT and K-9 teams to the sheriff's communities to free up resources for the investigation.
"We stand in solidarity with our Sheriff's Department colleagues during this incredibly difficult time and we remain ready to assist in any way we can," McDonnell said in statement.
Deputy Jason Zabala had the day off Friday and got a phone call about an accident.

“I think I was in shock at first, and then I remember when I was telling my wife, ‘I have to go to work’ — I just broke down,” he said. “These are individuals that I’ve known for better part of two decades.”
Zabala called the three people who lost their lives “some of the best deputies I’ve ever worked with.”
The L.A. County Sheriff's Department is the nation's largest local sheriff's agency.
Deputies patrol L.A. County courthouses, jails and unincorporated communities and provide police services to cities that contract with the department.
Friday's blast marks the deadliest law enforcement-related explosion in Southern California in nearly 40 years.

Zabala, the sheriff’s deputy who knew those who were killed, said that the job has risks and its share of heartbreak, including responding to the devastating wildfires that struck the Los Angeles area in January.

“You go through a lot as your career goes on in the sheriff’s department. But you’re never prepared for ‘Hey, three of your comrades just, just died today,’” he said. “It’s very hard to process, even with all that.”

title: Josh Lucas Marries Meteorologist Brianna Ruffalo In Vatican Ceremony
summary: Josh Lucas officially married meteorologist Brianna Ruffalo in a ceremony set in Vatican City.
story: Josh Lucas officially married meteorologist Brianna Ruffalo in a ceremony set in Vatican City.

The "Sweet Home Alabama" actor shared photos from their wedding to Instagram July 18. Lucas and Ruffalo shared a kiss in the Vatican in several black-and-white shots, with St. Peter's Basilica in the background.
In a second post, Lucas posed by leaning against a wall as his new bride walked by in her wedding gown, a lace umbrella in hand.

In the caption, Lucas thanked his photographer, their team of wedding planners and everyone "who helped make the dream of wedding in the #vatican come true… many many people to thank for this to come…"
On her own Instagram page, Ruffalo, who works as a meteorologist for ABC 7 in Los Angeles, also shared photos from their nuptials.
"Mr. and Mrs. Incredibly blessed to receive this sacrament together inside the heart of the Catholic Church and holy city," she captioned a carousel of pics.
In another post, she reflected on the people throughout her life who contributed to her getting married in the seat of the Catholic Church.

"We are grateful to the many people who helped us get to this moment in the Catholic Church," she wrote in part. "I am so thankful for Father Winters at the parish I grew up in, and Sister Angelica at the archdiocese of Los Angeles- as well as several others within the archdiocese."
Lucas and Ruffalo, who first started dating about three years ago, announced their engagement on social media in June 2024.

“For the last 2 years in Every Way and Every Day this beautiful soul has made me and my life better, deeper, and more whole,” Lucas said in his caption at the time. “I am so grateful and thrilled she said ‘Yes’. I WAY love you Brianna.”
Their wedding day in the Vatican notably comes just months after the Catholic Church elected its next leader, American Robert Prevost, now known as Pope Leo XIV.

title: Kelly Clarkson's Daughter, 11, Duets Her 'Favorite Song' With Mom in Las Vegas
summary: During her Las Vegas Residency, Kelly Clarkson brought her 11-year-old daughter, River Rose, onstage with her to sing "Heartbeat Song."
story: Kelly Clarkson's 11-year-old daughter, River Rose, shares her mom's love of singing.
The mom of two invited River Rose on stage to sing with her during a July 18 show she had at the Colosseum at Caesars Palace, part of her ongoing residency in Las Vegas.
When River Rose went on stage, she gave her mom a big hug before she joined Clarkson in singing "Heartbeat Song." Fans captured the moment on video and shared it on social media.
"We're going to do her favorite song," Clarkson told the crowd.
The "Breakaway" singer then turned to her daughter and told her she looked "super cute" in her black jeans and graphic T-shirt, which matched her mom's outfit.
In a clip, River Rose can be seen jumping up and down beside her mom once they started singing the chorus together. Clarkson later placed her arm around her daughter, who was smiling from ear-to-ear.
"Adorable," one person said of the video on X.
Another wrote, "This is so sweet," and a third added, noting the mother and daughter's similar outfits, "They’re twinning!"

"Heartbeat Song" holds a special place in River Rose's heart. When Clarkson performed the same tune with her daughter in 2023 as part of her first Las Vegas residency, she told the crowd why River Rose likes the upbeat track so much.
“She’s been jamming to this song since she was a baby,” the three-time Grammy-winner said. “She loves this song so much, so she was like, ‘Can I sing this song?’"
On July 4th, Clarkson was supposed to embark on her second Las Vegas residency, “Kelly Clarkson: Studio Sessions." However, she ended up postponing the start of her residency because of vocal issues.

“The prep and rehearsals have taken a toll on my voice. I want the shows to be perfect for y’all and I need to protect myself from doing serious damage so I am taking this weekend and next week to rest up so that we can deliver what you all deserve,” she said on Instagram.
Due to the postponement, Clarkson didn't start her residency until July 11. She'll be performing there throughout the summer, with her final "Studio Sessions" show scheduled for November.

title: Katy Perry Nearly Falls Off Flying Prop After Apparent Malfunction
summary: Katy Perry had quite the fright when she nearly fell mid-air into the crowd while performing atop a giant butterfly prop onstage.
story: Katy Perry had quite the fright when she nearly fell midair into the crowd while performing atop a giant butterfly prop.

The close call occurred July 18 at Chase Center in San Francisco, one of Perry's stops on her “Lifetimes Tour." During part of the show, Perry climbs atop the prop to sing her 2013 motivational song "Roar."
But on July 18, right when she was about to sing the chorus, the prop seemingly malfunctioned, tilted forward and abruptly dropped several feet while Perry held on tight.
When the prop appeared to be moving correctly again, Perry took a second to steady herself before she resumed singing to the crowd.
The frightful moment was captured by fans and has since been shared on X.

On her Instagram story, Perry seemingly joked about the moment by sharing a close-up photo of her looking terrified as the prop fell. Over the picture, she wrote, "Goodnight San Fran." Representatives for Perry did not immediately respond to NBC News' request for comment.
Beyoncé also recently experienced technical difficulties with a flying prop when she performed in her hometown of Houston, Texas, on June 28.

During the "Texas Hold 'Em" singer's concert, she sang atop a prop car suspended in the air. Normally, the car flies over the crowd as she sings "16 Carriages," but during the Houston show, the car began tilting to the side, putting Beyoncé in an scary position.
Beyoncé eventually paused the song so she could be lowered to the ground.
Once there, she finished her performance on solid ground as the crowd continued cheering for her.
“I want to thank y’all for loving me,” she told the audience. “If ever I fall, I know y’all would catch me.”
Beyoncé’s company Parkwood Entertainment later released a statement and said the car tilted due to a “technical mishap.”
“She was quickly lowered and no one was injured,” the statement read.

title: The 1 Thing Henry Cavill Asked James Gunn After Learning He'd No Longer Be 'Superman'
summary: Director James Gunn shared Henry Cavill’s reaction to his recasting in the new “Superman” film.
story: Director James Gunn shared Henry Cavill’s reaction to his recasting in the new “Superman” film.
Gunn spoke about his conversation with Cavill during a recent appearance on Josh Horowitz’ “Happy Sad Confused” podcast.

Horowitz asked Gunn about how he was able to break the news to Cavill, who portrayed Superman in several films, including 2013’s “Man of Steel” and 2016’s “Batman v Superman,” after he publicly announced in October 2022 that he would be returning as Superman.

Gunn explained, “We were dealing with trying to figure out if we could take the job at DC Studios and we’re talking to David Zaslav (CEO of Warner Bros. Discovery) and talking to all the legal people there and figuring out what our deals would be.”

“And the day our deal closed, all of a sudden, they were announcing that Henry was back and I’m like ‘What is going on?’” he added. “We know what the plan is. The plan was to come in and do ‘Superman.’”
Gunn said that it was “really unfair” to Cavill and called the situation “a total bummer.”

“There was a vacuum at the time and a lot of people were…They wanted to take on what they wanted to do at DC and were trying to force their way,” Gunn said. “It was never part of the equation for David Zaslav who was the head ...”

Gunn said the situation was “really unfortunate” when he and Peter Safran (co-CEO of DC Studios ) came into the picture,” explaining, “I’m like, this poor guy, so Peter and I knew the right thing to do is to sit down with him and talk to him.”

“We sat down, we talked to him, he was an absolute gentleman, a great guy about it,” Gunn said of Cavill. “He said, ‘The only thing I ask is that I’m able to reveal it myself as opposed to coming from you guys.’”

When asked by Horowitz if Gunn would ever include Cavill in a future DC Studios project or if that would be too confusing for viewers, the director added, “I talked to him about it on that day, so no, I would love to put Henry in something.”
In October 2022, Cavill announced that he would be reprising his role as Superman in a post on Instagram, sharing a video message to his fans.
However, months later in December 2022, the actor shared on social media that he would not be returning.
In a statement posted on Instagram, Cavill wrote in part, “I have just had a meeting with James Gunn and Peter Safran and it’s sad news, everyone. I will, after all, not be returning as Superman.”

“After being told by the studio to announce my return back in October, prior to their hire, this news isn’t the easiest, but that’s life,” Cavill added. “The changing of the guard is something that happens. I respect that. James and Peter have a universe to build. I wish them and all involved with the new universe the best of luck, and the happiest of fortunes.”
Cavill ended his statement on a high note, writing, “My turn to wear the cape has passed, but what Superman stands for never will. It’s been a fun ride with you all, onwards and upwards.”

title: Billy Joel's Wives: Meet the 4 Women Who've Said 'I Do' to the Piano Man
summary: Who are Billy Joel's wives? Meet the four women he was married ot.
story: Five-time Grammy winner Billy Joel is a four-time husband.
The legendary singer-songwriter, who’s currently married to Alexis Roderick Joel, said “I do” to three other women before he wed his final match in 2015.

Of course, it’s no surprise that the man who penned beloved love ballads, like “Just the Way You Are,” “She’s Always a Woman” and “She’s Got a Way,” has fallen love a few times himself. But who are the wives who’ve walked down the aisle alongside him?
Read on to learn more about each of the 76-year-old partners, past and present, including his “Uptown Girl” and his longest lasting love.
Elizabeth Weber (1973–1982)
When Joel met his first wife-to-be, Elizabeth Weber, her last name was Small — and it’s not just a coincidence that she shared the same last name as his then-best friend and bandmate Jon Small.

In 1970, the married Smalls invited Joel to live with them and their son, out of both musical convenience and financial need. But the arrangement crumbled once an affair between Joel and Elizabeth Small began. Soon after it was discovered, Elizabeth Small went back to the name Weber, breaking off things with both her ex-husband and Joel.
For a while.
Even though Joel felt terrible in the wake of the affair, he couldn’t get Weber out of his head or heart.

“She was — different,” Joel recalled in Fred Schruers’ 2015 book, “Billy Joel: The Definitive Biography.” “She wasn’t like a lot of the other girls I knew at that time who had taken home ec and cooking classes. She was a very bright woman, and she wasn’t afraid to show how smart she was. I suppose that made her kind of exotic. Intelligent and not afraid to speak her mind, but could also be seductive. Almost like a European type — not a typical American girl.”
Joel and Weber eventually rekindled their relationship (just as Joel and Small eventually renewed their friendship). And in 1973, Weber became both Joel’s wife and his manager.
The hit maker told Schruers that Weber became his muse, inspiring much of his music around the time of his 1977 album “The Stranger.”
The couple parted ways in 1982.
Christie Brinkley (1985–1994)
Not long after his split from Weber, Joel met supermodel Christie Brinkley.
“We were friends first,” Joel explained in biographer Hank Bordowitz’s “Billy Joel: The Life and Times of an Angry Young Man.” “I was nuts about her, but it took her a while to reciprocate.”
In the same book, Brinkley said it was Joel's “heart and soul” that finally drew her in and made her “want to marry him.”
But before they swapped vows, they celebrated their relationship in song with Joel’s 1983 hit, “Uptown Girl,” written in part about Brinkley and starring her in the accompanying music video.
The pair went on to wed in March 1985, and in December of that same year, they welcomed a child together, daughter Alexa Ray Joel.

Though Joel and Brinkley divorced in 1994, they remain close friends. She even consulted him before writing about some of their more difficult days together in her 2025 memoir, also titled “Uptown Girl.”
“He said, ‘Just say what you need to say,’” Brinkley shared in an interview with TODAY.
Katie Lee (2004–2009)

The “You May Be Right” singer met chef, food critic and cookbook author Katie Lee in 2002, and the pair quickly struck up a friendship. Lee, at the time, had to brush up on Joel's work to really find out about her pal.
“I went out and bought the greatest hits album, and I was like, ‘Oh, I know “Still Rock and Roll,” I know “My Life” — I love these songs,’” she noted in “Billy Joel: The Definitive Biography.”
She added that, eventually, she learned every word to all his songs.
Lee was 23 when she and Joel said their “I dos” in an October 2004 ceremony outside at his Long Island mansion.
But by 2009, Joel and Lee broke up.

“After nearly five years of marriage, Billy and Katie have decided to separate,” a statement from Joel’s rep read. “The decision is the result of much thought and consideration. Billy and Katie remain caring friends, with admiration and respect for each other.”
Alexis Roderick (2015–present)
That same year, Joel met the woman who would become his most enduring partner in life, Alexis Roderick or, as he likes to call her, “A-Rod.”

The equestrian and former finance executive, who’s 33 years Joel’s junior, gave the music icon a ride home following their happenstance introduction at a restaurant. That led to a piano performance for one and maybe something more.
“I may have got a little fresh,” Joel later confessed to The New Yorker.
Months after that, they officially started dating and soon, they moved in together. But unlike some of his earlier relationships, there was no rush to the altar.

Joel and Roderick waited until July 15, 2015 to wed. The following month, they welcomed their first child together, daughter Della Rose Joel. They expanded their family two years later with the arrival of another daughter, Remy Anne Joel.
Joel and his fourth wife have remained by each other’s side since, through health and happiness and through hard times.

In May 2025, Joel revealed he’d been diagnosed with a rare but reversible brain disorder, a form of dementia called normal pressure hydrocephalus. In response to his announcement, Alexis Roderick Joel took to the singer’s Instagram account to share a message with his fans on behalf of her and their daughters.

“Thank you for the outpouring of love and support,” she wrote. “We are so grateful for the wonderful care and swift diagnosis we received. Bill is beloved by so many, and to us, he is a father and husband who is at the center of our world.”

title: EXCLUSIVE: JoJo Siwa Responds to Kim Carnes' Criticism of Her 'Bette Davis Eyes' Cover
summary: JoJo Siwa sits down with TODAY.com to share her cover of “Bette Davis Eyes.”
story: JoJo Siwa has seen your “Bette Davis Eyes” videos.

Her cover of Kim Carnes’ 1981 song neared the top of the U.K pop charts, but has also been met with a mix of fascination and bewilderment online. TikTokers are creating versions of their own “Bette Davis Eyes,” wearing a version of the 1950s-inspired blue top she wears in the video and re-creating her raspy voice.

“Some of them, I die laughing,” Siwa tells TODAY.com in a Zoom interview. “Then there’s some that I’m like, ‘Where do people get the audacity? Why do people feel OK to sleep at night?' There’s a fine line of comedy and fine line of trashing.’”
Siwa says she was walking recently and a man around her age came up to her singing “Bette Davis Eyes” in a “fake raspy voice.”

“I turn around at him and said, ‘Nice singing,’” she says. “He ran off. I was just like — I wish I would’ve pulled him aside and said, ‘Look. If you’re going to make fun of me, the least you could do is have a conversation with me.’ I probably would have taken him to go buy a Gucci bag.”
Love it or hate it, “Bette Davis Eyes” has become a cultural moment — which is ironic, considering Siwa didn’t want to sing it in the first place. The idea came from a producer on her music team.

“She played ‘Bette Davis Eyes’ and said, ‘I bet you don’t even know this song, but your voice would be incredible on it,'” Siwa recalls. Siwa was born in 2003, over two decades after Kim Carnes’ song spent nine consecutive weeks at No. 1 on the Billboard Hot 100 and became an ‘80s anthem.
After receiving criticism for her performances on Season 3 of “The Masked Singer,” the “Dance Moms” star was hesitant to make a cover her next career step.
“Absolutely not. Never. Nope, nope, not happening. I got too shy, too insecure,” she remembers saying.

The conversation was tabled until she was planning her set at the Tecate Emblema music festival in Mexico City and had 20 minutes left to fill. Siwa’s mom brought up “Bette Davis Eyes.” Still unsure, Siwa says she “actually started crying” over the idea of singing it onstage.
“My mom was like, ‘You can. You’re saying you can’t, but you can,’” she remembers her mom saying. “She told me, ‘Do something that makes you want to sing the song.’”
This advice inspired the viral moment where Siwa changed the lyrics of “Bette Davis Eyes” to “Chris Hughes's eyes” onstage.

Those following Siwa’s personal life would know exactly what that means. It’s a reference to her boyfriend, former “Love Island” contestant Chris Hughes. The two met on “Big Brother UK.” Siwa entered the show in a relationship with Kath Ebbs, an Australian influencer who identifies as a "gender queer lesbian." The night the show ended, Siwa and Ebbs split up. Weeks later, Siwa and Hughes made things official. (In fact, he interrupted Siwa's conversation with TODAY.com with his rendition of “You Are My Sunshine.”)

After performing the song live for the first time, she was struck and surprised by the feedback. “The response to it was unreal,” Siwa says. “People had so much good to say about it … people actually want this.”
Siwa teased a recorded version on her TikTok twice then released the full cover on July 10 — and the reactions, some of them more negative, poured in.
Siwa says she’s come to expect commentary — it happened last summer after she released “Karma,” which at the time seemed like an edgy rebrand from her time as a child star.
“When I’m posting something, I’m sort of asking for that, right? I think people like to get a laugh. And I know I like to be a laugh,” she says.
“When I’m posting something, I’m sort of asking for that, right? I think people like to get a laugh. And I know I like to be a laugh.”
JoJo siwa

What does Siwa have to say to her haters? “All good, troops, all good. Sometimes I hate me too, and it’s all good,” Siwa says, laughing. “As long as you’re getting a smile or a laugh, and I’m not ruining your day… Goal achieved from me.”
One of the skeptics was Carnes herself. The singer posted a now deleted TikTok about Siwa’s song, implying Siwa’s version lacked “authenticity.”

Carnes later clarified her statement to TMZ, saying she “strongly rejects(s) the kind of hate and personal attacks I’ve seen online” but also believes “artists have the right to speak openly about how something makes them feel — especially when it’s as personal as your voice.”
Carnes said Siwa's rendition "felt a bit too close" to her version, including “the phrasing, the tone, even the little inflections."

“Kim kind of came out and said some stuff, but it actually fascinates me, what she said,” Siwa tells TODAY.com. “As an artist, what you want to do is inspire people, and I think the most beautiful thing is to have another artist be inspired by you.”

Other artists who covered the song, like Taylor Swift, didn’t use rasp like Carnes. Siwa defends keeping the rasp in her cover. For one, Siwa says she has “very broken vocal chords” that make it possible to “kind of replicate” Carnes’ singing style.
She also “didn’t want to sing the song like a natural beauty — I wanted to sing the song the way it inspired me,” she says. “You want that rasp in there.”

During the recording session, she asked for no water. “The raspier I get, the better it is. So my voice is just screwed after, but worth it absolutely. Now I’ll incorporate that super raspy tone into more,” she says.
Less natural was the look for the music video. Siwa says she “absolutely hates” changing up her look.

“I put the costume on and I put the wig on and I was laughing at myself in the mural. Like, there’s there’s no way this is happening. This is hysterical. I look in the mirror and I’m cackling at myself,” she says. “It’s a little bit like Halloween.”

Beyond Siwa’s cover, “Bette Davis Eyes” is having a moment this summer — Ethel Cain also covered it and it figured prominently in Episode 7 of “And Just Like That” Season 3. Siwa says she missed the feature, as she spends most of her leisure time listening to the “Hamilton” soundtrack or watching sports with Hughes.
“I’ve really found that I’ve got a clear sense of vision again, in my personal life, but especially in my career.”
The moment inspired Siwa for her next chapter. She’s now working on a new single inspired by “Bette Davis Eyes,” set to release in August.
“It’s interesting, because, for the first time, I’ve actually enjoyed writing a song,” Siwa says about the potential new single.
Post “Big Brother” and “Bette Davis,” Siwa says she “knows exactly” what she wants in her life.
“I’ve really found that I’ve got a clear sense of vision again, in my personal life, but especially in my career.”

title: 'Clueless' Turns 30! Look Back at Alicia Silverstone on TODAY in 1995
summary: "Clueless" has its 30th anniversary. SEe Alicia Silverstone on TODAY in 1995.
story: We're about to go postal! "Clueless" is officially 30 years old.
The hit rom-com starring Alicia Silverstone as fashionista Cher Horowitz, Paul Rudd as Josh, Stacey Dash as Dionne and Brittany Murphy as Tai, came out three decades ago on July 19, 1995.

In the 30 years since its release, the movie's cultural legacy has only grown stronger. Its slang has become part of the cultural lexicon and its characters are a popular choice for duo Halloween costumes. Many celebrities have dressed up as Cher and Dionne as well, such as Kim Kardashian and her daughter North West, Iggy Azalea and Sabrina Carpenter.
But when Silverstone visited to TODAY in 1995, when she was about 19 years old, she had no idea about the impact "Clueless" and Cher would have.
During her chat on TODAY, Silverstone said she disagreed with the movie's title. She never saw Cher as clueless, even though her character did say some head-scratching things.

"The title is the one thing that throws me off because I think that Cher is a very intelligent character and the whole film is so intelligent. That title is sort of a joke, because the characters are so defined and so well-rounded that they really aren't clueless," she said.
In "Clueless," an adaptation of Jane Austen's "Emma," Cher tries to play matchmaker for the people around her. Or, if she sees someone in need of a social boost, she'll step in with a makeover.

Cher spoke in a type of Valley Girl dialect that confounded some theatergoers. But in her world, her words made perfect sense. The only way to really catch on to what she's saying is to see the way she uses the term.
Speaking to TODAY, Silverstone explained where some of Cher's words originated.
Cher calls her stepbrother, Josh, a "Baldwin" after she realizes that he's kind of attractive.
"A Baldwin is the hottest guy there is," Silverstone explained on TODAY.
As for why she refers to Tai’s uncool skater friends as Barneys? "Barney, that's actually originally from 'The Flintstones,'" Silverstone said.
Cher’s nickname for her mom, Betty, is also from “The Flintstones,” Silverstone said — but more positive and meant to express her natural beauty.
Cher also uses a piece of slang that took off in the '90s: "Going postal." Silverstone explained on TODAY that “postal” means “crazy.”
“‘Postal’ is a great word,” she laughed. "(It means) she goes absolutely out of her mind, crazy."
On TODAY, Silverstone said she was "nervous" to start in "Clueless," which was her first comedy.

“I thought, ‘I’m not funny. I can’t do that,’ but when I finally got into it and realized that Cher was not just superficial and shallow, she’s a really lovable, compassionate, happy girl, it made it all seem perfect,” Silverstone said.

title: Company Linked to Viral Video from Coldplay Concert Speaks Out
summary: Astronomer, the company tied to a viral video from a Coldplay concert, says it's launched a "formal investigation" into the matter.
story: The company at the center of online conversation regarding a viral video from a Coldplay concert says it's launched a "formal investigation" into the matter and has placed its CEO on leave.
During a July 16 concert at Massachusetts' Gillette Stadium, two people were shown embracing on camera. But once they appeared on the jumbotron, they hid their faces from view.
The band's lead singer, Chris Martin, then joked from the stage, "Either they’re having an affair or they’re just very shy."
Clips of the moment soon spread across the internet with people online identifying at least one person in connection with Astronomer, a data infrastructure company.

"Astronomer is committed to the values and culture that have guided us since our founding. Our leaders are expected to set the standard in both conduct and accountability," the company said in a statement shared to X July 18. "The Board of Directors has initiated a formal investigation into this matter and we will have additional details to share very shortly."
Online, people identified one person in the video as Astronomer's CEO Andy Byron. NBC News has not independently confirmed he was in the footage but has reached out to Byron for comment.
"Andy Byron has not put out any statement, reports saying otherwise are all incorrect," Astronomer said in the statement, adding, "no other employees were in the video."
Hours later, the company announced that Byron has been placed on leave.

In the wake of the viral video, photos of a fake post made to appear like it came from Coldplay's official X account also made the rounds. The post appeared to joke about having camera-free zones at future concerts. A representative for the band confirmed to TODAY.com the post is fake.

title: Where Was 'The Summer I Turned Pretty' Season 3 Filmed?
summary: Season 3 of "The Summer I Turned Pretty" will bring fans back to Cousins Beach, the fictional seaside town that narrator Isabel "Belly" Conklin often calls her favorite place on Earth
story: Season 3 of "The Summer I Turned Pretty" will bring fans back to Cousins Beach, the fictional seaside town that narrator Isabel "Belly" Conklin often calls her favorite place on Earth.
In the world of show, Cousins is set somewhere in the Northeast, and was inspired by places like Massachusetts' Cape Cod and Martha's Vineyard as well as the Hamptons in New York.

But the beach scenes were filmed in a place close to author Jenny Han's heart: the coast of North Carolina. And with each new season, the world of the show has expanded as we follow characters to college and beyond.
Where Is Cousins Beach?

Throughout the show’s three seasons, “The Summer I Turned Pretty” has been filmed in Wilmington, North Carolina, a port city on the southern end of North Carolina’s coast. Beaches near Wilmington include Carolina Beach, Kure Beach and Wrightsville Beach.
Han, who wrote the original book trilogy the show is based on and serves as co-showrunner, told the Boston Globe in 2023 that Cousins was based on “a lot of the beaches I’ve been to in my life.”

“It’s mostly based on Cape Cod, but also, at that time, I was going to Martha’s Vineyard and the Hamptons. And it’s also based a little bit on the beach I went to growing up, which was Nags Head,” she said.
Nags Head is a beach on the Outer Banks of North Carolina, located about 200 miles from Wilmington.
Tom Everett Scott, who stars in the show as Conrad and Jeremiah's dad, Adam Fisher, calls Wilmington "a great American beach town."

"I live in California — there's beautiful beaches there. But there's something about that East Coast, walking through the sand dunes with the grass and the piers and the crystal blue water," Scott tells TODAY.com. "The water is so warm."
"Some of the cast were out there surfing, we'd go to the beach all the time," he adds. "I think that's my favorite beach now in the States."
Where Were the Finch College Scenes Filmed?

Season 3 of "The Summer I Turned Pretty," which premiered with two episodes on Prime Video July 16, opens with Belly (Lola Tung) and her boyfriend, Jeremiah Fisher (Gavin Casalegno), as they finish up another semester at Finch College. The season features a four-year time jump, with the events occurring as Belly wraps up her junior year of college.
Finch College is not a real place, though the setting used for filming scenes there is.
Finch College was brought to life by author Jenny Han's alma mater, the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.
A member of the class of 2002, Han calls filming at UNC a “dream come true.” She tells TODAY.com one of their shooting locations, Old East, was her old dorm.

“I just remember in college, lying on that lawn outside of Old East, and my roommates’ stereo, and my favorite song is ‘Tangerine,’” Han tells TODAY.com. “And I would play that song and listen to it and look up at the stars — and I just never would have thought I’d be back there to film something, a story that I wrote.”

Chapel Hill is a small town in the middle of the state and one of the points of North Carolina's bustling Research Triangle, which also consists of Raleigh's North Carolina State University and Durham's Duke University.
So far, the show has featured shots from across UNC's campus, including the town's main thoroughfare, Franklin Street, academic buildings like Pettigrew Hall and the campus' quad.
This isn't the first time a North Carolina university has stood in for another in "The Summer I Turned Pretty."
In Season 2, Conrad Fisher (Christopher Briney) originally attended Brown University, but the campus scenes were filmed at the University of North Carolina at Wilmington.

title: Huda Did Her 'Big One' — And Has No Regrets About Her 'Love Island USA' Exit
summary: ‘Love Island USA’ star Huda opens up about doing her “big one,” ending things with Chris, and what she’s learned about love, growth, and letting go.
story: The Huda Mustafa who entered the “Love Island USA” villa and the one who walked out just before the finale were two different people.

What happened in between — a toxic relationship that played out on national TV, a challenge performance that broke the internet, and the hard-won realization that sometimes the strongest thing you can do is walk away — is a story of growth, controversy and the power of choosing yourself.

From day one, the North Carolina native was impossible to ignore. Her bold energy and intense approach to connections made her one of the season’s most talked-about contestants, generating equal parts admiration and criticism from viewers who couldn’t look away. She threw herself into villa life with the kind of all-or-nothing intensity that reality TV thrives on, but that same intensity would soon become her biggest challenge.

Her relationship with Jeremiah Brown started like a wildfire — passionate, consuming, and ultimately destructive. What began as one of the villa’s strongest couples quickly devolved into something viewers and fellow Islanders alike recognized as toxic, marked by love-bombing, explosive fights and drama that extended far beyond their personal bubble. It was messy, it was painful and it was all happening under the unforgiving gaze of cameras and public opinion.

Then came the Heart Rate Challenge, the moment that would spark conversations that extended far beyond the show. A fan-favorite challenge, the Heart Rate Challenge tasks Islanders with performing steamy dances to see who can raise heart rates the most, often triggering tension and jealousy.

When Huda decided to do her “biggest one,” as she puts it to TODAY.com, the performance sent shockwaves through the villa and ignited viral speculation across social media. It was bold, it was controversial, and it was quintessentially Huda — unapologetic and competitive to her core.

But perhaps the most surprising chapter in her “Love Island USA” journey came at the very end. After a brief romance with Chris, Huda made a decision that stunned viewers: she chose to walk away on her own terms, right before the season finale. For many fans, it wasn’t just an exit — it was a redemption arc, a moment where she finally listened to her own voice over the noise of expectations and pressure.
“I’m not going to fake something if I don’t believe it’s there,” Huda tells TODAY.com in an exclusive interview.
Now, safely removed from the villa’s pressure cooker environment, she’s ready to unpack it all: the love, the criticism, the personal growth, and the power that comes with choosing to move on.
This interview has been edited for clarity.
How does it feel to be back in the real world?

It’s overwhelming, but in a good way. It really is. I’m honestly so happy that I went through that experience, and I’m so happy to come out of that with so much love, especially while being in there and thinking I’m completely hated. Mind you, like there are people that don’t like me. That’s fine. Everyone’s entitled to their opinion. But just seeing all of the love, which is obviously what I’m focusing on, it’s like, wow — I’m speechless. Like, it’s overwhelming. I’m trying to get up to date on everything.

In the moment, it was a shock when America voted to pair Iris with Jeremiah when, at the time, you two were probably the strongest couple in the villa. How do you look back on that moment now and how do you look back on your connection overall with Jeremiah?

I think that we were toxic. We were both very toxic. Was I perfect in that? No. Was he perfect in that? No. I can understand why they would have separated us. America’s vote, it took me by surprise in the moment, because I wasn’t seeing things from an outside perspective. But looking at it from a different perspective, I can understand why.

He told me himself, like he was learning through us. Things that I told him to do, he was changing to do it for other women. And I think that people can relate to that. I think a lot of girls, you know, have been the girl that kind of prepared a man to be in a relationship.
Have you spoken to Jeremiah at all since leaving the villa, or do you plan on reconnecting with him?
Naur, no, no. Uh-uh, no no.

I think a lot of women can relate to going through a bad relationship and coming out stronger on the other side, which we saw through your relationship with Jeremiah. What have you learned that you’ll apply in future relationships?

Communicating in more of a mature way. Not letting my emotions get the best of me. Figure out a way to compromise in ways instead of just focusing on getting my point across. Really hearing the other person out.

I think I would hold a lot of things in out of fear. It's better to just say it. Even if it ends things, it’s just better to talk about it. There’s a lot of things — slowing down in relationships, not getting too physical too fast, really getting to know somebody. It was a good learning experience in all honesty.
The Heart Rate Challenge sparked tension in the villa. Why do you think that specific challenge caused so much fighting?

I went in with a competitive mindset. It's just a challenge. I don’t have feelings towards these guys in that way, but I’m doing it to win. It’s out of my control whether or not I’m raising their heart rate or not. Talk to your man about that, not me.

Everyone had really high expectations for me. Every girl and every guy was like, “Huda, do your big one. Huda, this is your time to shine.” I’m like, OK, cool. But I will do my big one. I did my biggest one. And I mean, everybody consented to everything beforehand. We made sure of that.
The men were enjoying their time until they saw their girlies weren’t enjoying that, and that’s when it was too much.

I’ve had these conversations off camera with certain guys who had agreed with me that yeah, when they saw their girls’ reaction they realized, OK, maybe that was too much. It’s kind of like when your man goes to a bachelor party and the girl’s like, "I didn’t like that." And they’re like, "Damn, OK, maybe I did f— up."
There were a lot of factors that weren’t even shown that played into my decision at that time. I think everyone was caught off guard, but I’m sure he wasn’t. We knew that that was coming.

Like, he would tell me to shut up. When I’m asking you to compliment me in a meaningful way multiple times, knowing that that’s my love language, I get “gyatt” and “sheesh.” So it’s like, why am I settling? Why would I settle for something like that?

He would make commentary on other women. He had a wandering eye, especially off-camera. He would walk past me and not even look at me, he wouldn’t acknowledge me in conversations. And I peeped all of these things. I was catching them and I kept my mouth shut, but I was keeping them in the back of my mind because I wanted him to show me his true self without me having to guide him. That’s the whole thing I played into my final decision and I stand on that.
He wasn’t all bad, but there are things that are really important to me that are non-negotiables. That’s what made me make my decision.

title: Jennifer Love Hewitt Addresses Alleged Feud With Sarah Michelle Gellar
summary: Jennifer Love Hewitt addressed rumors that she's feuding with Sarah Michelle Gellar and said she doesn't "even know what that was or how that all came to be."
story: Jennifer Love Hewitt is setting the record straight.
In a July 18 interview with Vulture, Hewitt shut down rumors that she’s feuding with her former “I Know What You Did Last Summer” co-star Sarah Michelle Gellar.
Rumors about Hewitt and Gellar’s relationship re-ignited at the “I Know What You Did Last Summer” premiere on July 14, when the two did not take a photo together.
Hewitt is reprising her role in the movie with Freddie Prinze Jr.; Gellar is married to Prinze Jr. and starred in the original.

“I honestly don’t even know what that was or how that all came to be,” Hewitt told Vulture. “I just think people don’t want the narrative to be easy. Why do we always have to be against each other and out for each other?”
When asked if she’s spoken to Gellar about them reportedly being on the outs, Hewitt said, “I haven’t seen Sarah.”

“Literally, we’ve not talked since I saw her at 18 years old when the first movie came out. That’s why it’s so funny to me. People were like, ‘Say something back.’ And I’m like, ‘What am I going to say? I’ve not seen her.’ On my side, we’re good. I have no idea where this is coming from.”
Hewitt spoke to Vulture before the red carpet premiere. When the interviewer noted that Hewitt would see Gellar at the premiere, she responded, “I hope so.”
But after the red carpet for the "I Know What You Did Last Summer" sequel unfolded, fans noticed Hewitt and Gellar didn’t take any pictures together.
Gellar responded to the speculation in an Instagram comment.

“For everyone asking — I never got to see @jenniferlovehewitt who is fantastic in the movie. I was inside with my kids when the big carpet happened,” she said. “And unfortunately JLH didn’t come to the after party. If you have ever been to one of these it’s crazy.”
“I sadly didn’t get pics with most of the cast. But that doesn’t change how amazing I think they all are,” she continued. “Unfortunately some things happen only in real life and not online.”
This isn’t the first time people have scrutinized their relationship. Back in December, fans read into Gellar’s response when Extra asked whether Hewitt would be returning for the sequel.
“I have nothing to do with that,” she said.

Gellar’s answer was terse enough to spark rumors of tension. In response to the speculation, the “Buffy” star took to her Instagram Stories to reveal why she looked like a “deer in the highlights” while answering the reporter’s question.

“Aspiring actors please note: This ‘deer in the headlights’ reaction is perfect for when you are excited to see so many old friends in one project but have already stupidly forgotten what NDA means once this month,” she said.

title: A 'Blue Bloods' Star Is Joining Donnie Wahlberg for His New Spinoff
summary: Donnie Wahlberg has announced "Blue Bloods" co-star Bridget Moynahan will join him in the premiere episode of the CBS spinoff "Boston Blue."
story: Donnie Wahlberg has brought a member of his "Blue Bloods" family to Boston.

The actor shared on Instagram on July 18 that Bridget Moynahan, who played his character's sister on "Blue Bloods," will be making an appearance in the premiere of Wahlberg's new spinoff, "Boston Blue," which debuts on CBS on Oct. 17.

"Reunited and (it) feels so good!" Wahlberg captioned a photo of him with Moynahan. "So excited to have my dear friend, and TV sister @bridgetmoynahan, join me for a special guest appearance in the premiere episode of #BostonBlue! She’ll also be bringing her incredible directing talents to the show this season! More fun (and surprises) to come. 👀 Let’s go!"
The "John Wick" actor, 54, played Erin Reagan, the sister of Wahlberg's Detective Danny Reagan, on the CBS hit "Blue Bloods," which concluded its 14-season run in 2024.

Wahlberg reprises his role as Danny Reagan in "Boston Blue," which features his character leaving his position with the New York Police Department and becoming a detective with the Boston Police Department.
The cast also includes Sonequa Martin-Green as Danny Reagan's partner, Det. Lena Silvers, the oldest daughter of a prominent law enforcement family.

Other "Boston Blue" cast members include Mika Amonsen as Danny Reagan's son, Sean; Maggie Lawson as Sarah Silver; Marcus Scribner as Jonah Silver; Gloria Reuben as Mae Silver; and Ernie Hudson as Reverend Peters, according to Deadline.

Wahlberg, 55, was a mainstay on the "Blue Bloods" cast for all 14 seasons. He told People in 2024 he took some of his props and clothes as keepsakes at the end of the show's run and put them in his family's fast-food restaurant chain.
“I took my two Danny Reagan costumes — my blue suit and my dress blues,” he said. “I put them on mannequins and put them in a Wahlburgers.”
In an appearance on TODAY with Hoda & Jenna in October 2024, he said the 14 years he spent filming the show “went by in the blink of an eye.”
“It’s really more gratitude. It’s not sad-itude,” he said.

title: Why the Shocking Post-Credits Scene in ‘I Know What You Did Last Summer’ is Worth the Wait
summary: Twenty-seven years after a hook-wielding murderer in a fisherman's slicker terrorized a group of teens in Southport, North Carolina, a serial killer with a similar MO is on the loose.
story: Twenty-seven years after a hook-wielding murderer in a fisherman's slicker terrorized a group of teens in Southport, North Carolina, a serial killer with a similar MO is on the loose.
2025's "I Know What You Did Last Summer," a new movie with the same name as the 1997 slasher film, is less of a reboot and more of a sequel.

Similar to the original, the movie follows a group of teenagers — Ava (Chase Sui Wonders), Milo (Jonah Hauer-King), Danica (Madelyn Cline), Stevie (Sarah Pidgeon) and Teddy (Tyriq Withers) — who accidentally cause a major car accident that leads to a death. They flee the scene, get Teddy's dad (Billy Campbell), a wealthy real estate developer, to cover up their involvement, and vow to never speak of what happened again. All appears to go as planned until the next year when Danica receives a threatening note with a pointed message on it: "I know what you did last summer."

Danica's fiancé is murdered with a harpoon the same night, and two others are attacked by someone in a fisherman’s slicker. Eventually, the group seeks out the help of survivors of the original Southport massacre, Ray Bronson (Freddie Prinze Jr.) and Julie James (Jennifer Love Hewitt).

What ensues is a twisty, scary dive back into the history of Southport and the social dynamics that resulted in at least one person becoming a killer. It's full of plot twists, Easter eggs and surprising cameos — including one in the very last moments of the film.
Does 2025's 'I Know What You Did Last Summer' Have a Post-Credits Scene?
Yes! After the killer is revealed and the gory film has its bloody conclusion, the final girl(s!) are left standing, and the end credits start to roll. But, don't get up from your seat just yet.
"I Know What You Did Last Summer" does have a post-credits scene, and it's a nostalgic look back at the original franchise, bringing in a major cameo and a set-up for more stories in Southport.
What Happens In the ‘I Know What You Did Last Summer’ Post-Credits Scene?
Warning: Ahead are major spoilers for the ending of "I Know What You Did Last Summer."

In "I Know What You Did Last Summer," the brutal killer targeting the group turns out to be killers. Stevie (Sarah Pidgeon), one of the friends who witnessed the car accident, turned out to be friends with the person who died. Overwhelmed by grief, she decided to get revenge and seek help from her boss — none other than Ray Bronson.
The shocking twist came after Ray seemingly came to Ava's aid and killed Stevie by shooting her.

But in a final showdown between exes Ray and Julie, who reluctantly returned to Southport in the wake of the attacks, Ray reveals that he helped Stevie in part because everyone in Southport seemingly forgot about the trauma he and his friends faced all those years ago. Over the course of the film, the new group of friends have to uncover what happened to Ray and Julie through deep archival research and local legend, as the horrifying events had been effectively covered up for the sake of attracting tourists to the beach town.
As a result of the cover-up, Ray helps Stevie exact revenge on her friends and on the town at large.
But as Julie distracts him by shouting out her iconic line, "What are you waiting for," Ava shoots him in the back, killing him.
Ava reunites with Danica after they both spend some time in the hospital. While chatting on a bench, they reveal that Stevie is actually alive, establishing one lingering threat.

Then in a post-credits scene, Brandy reprises her role as Karla Wilson, who starred with Hewitt in the 1998 sequel, "I Still Know What You Did Last Summer." In that film, Julie and Karla go on a trip to the Bahamas and barely survive another killer’s attacks.

In the post-credits scene, Karla watches the news of the Southport murders at home. As she hears how Ray attacked Julie and was behind a new string of killings in Southport, the camera pans to a view from outside Karla's house. Then, ominous, suspenseful music starts playing, hinting that Karla might also be in danger. But when Karla gets to the door, it's Julie James, her old college roommate.

After reuniting, Julie shows Karla an old photo of themselves, with red X's over their faces — a not so subtle indication that they're on a killer's list. Julie asks Karla for her help, and she responds simply by asking who they have to take down next.

title: Coldplay Confirms Post About 'Camera-Free Audience Sections' for 'Sidepieces' Is Fake
summary: Coldplay has confirmed that a post on X saying it will offer special sections for concertgoers who are cheating on their significant others is fake.
story: Coldplay says a now-viral post on X informing fans it will offer special sections for concertgoers who are cheating on their significant others is not real.

“Starting with our next show, we’re introducing camera-free audience sections for people and their sidepieces,” read a screenshot of an alleged post that appeared to be from the band’s official X account.
“A thoughtful decision by Coldplay,” wrote an X user who shared the alleged post.
A representative for the band has confirmed with TODAY.com that the post is fake.

Coldplay found itself in the center of a storm when a camera panned to a couple in an embrace during a show on its “Music of the Spheres World Tour” at Gillette Stadium in Foxborough, Massachusetts, on July 16, prompting frontman Chris Martin to say, “Either they’re having an affair or they’re just very shy.”
The moment quickly went viral as people investigated what the man and woman were doing at the show. Coldplay has not commented on the matter.
Coldplay’s tour continues July 19 at Camp Randall Stadium in Madison, Wisconsin.

title: Sophie Turner Reveals the 1 Treat She Eats Every Day
summary: Appearing on "The Dish" podcast, Sophie Turner reveals the sweet treat she has on hand to enjoy every day: Milky Way chocolate bars.
story: Sophie Turner loves herself a little treat.

On July 9, “The Dish,” a podcast hosted by British presenter Nick Grimshaw and chef and restaurateur Angela Hartnett, dropped its interview with the “Game of Thrones” star. She made Hugo Spritz cocktails and gabbed with the hosts about her career and more.

During the chat, she remarked on her her lack of skill in the kitchen, but her passion for good food and shared a lot of her food likes, of which she has many: jacket potatoes, New York salads and what she calls a regular obsession: chocolate.
“One of the other things we noticed in your food likes was quite a lot of chocolate,” Grimshaw says. “How often are we indulging in the pursuit of great chocolate?”
“Every day, daily,” Turner says, adding that her go-to is Milky Way.
“I have in my house like little jars of, you know, proper food, like pasta and whatnot, and then right next to it is my jar of Milky Ways,” she explains.
Grimshaw asks her if anyone else gets to enjoy the candy.
“You know, the kids will try and take one but, ‘Hands off, that’s Mommy’s,’” Turner says, batting an imaginary hand away.

It’s worth noting that Milky Way bars in the United Kingdom — where this podcast was recorded — are slightly different from those in the States. Across the pond, Milky Ways don’t have the caramel layer that American ones have, which would make them more like Three Musketeers here.
Though she has an aggressive sweet tooth, Turner is also passionate about one savory food.
“You know what? I love sausages,” Turner says. “I really love them. I used to have a sausage reviewing page on Instagram. I did, called ‘Sophie’s Sausage Reviews.’”
The entire studio bursts out in laughter at this — but it’s true. But, unfortunately, she can’t run it anymore for a pretty relatable reason.
“I forgot my password,” she says.

title: See the 'Clueless' Cast Then and Now
summary: Where is the cast of Clueless now? What did they say about their life after the movie? Here's what to know.
story: "Clueless" is turning 30. It may be older — but it's never out of style, or out of the zeitgeist. In fact, the cult classic is in development at Peacock for a new series, with Silverstone reprising her role.
Written and directed by Amy Heckerling, "Clueless" is a modern adaptation of Jane Austen’s novel "Emma" set against the backdrop of a ‘90s Beverly Hills high school.
As soon as the meddling matchmaker Cher meets Tai, a new transfer student, she and her fashionista bestie, Dionne, decide it’s only but their civic duty to give Tai a much-needed makeover.
Let's look back at where the stars are now and what they said about "Clueless's" cultural legacy.
Alicia Silverstone

Alicia Silverstone was everywhere in the late '90s, including thrillers like "The Crush" and "The Babysitter" and romances like "Blast from the Past." She also was Batgirl in "Batman & Robin" in 1997. She's acted steadily since, including in a reunion with Amy Heckerling for the comedy horror movie "Vamps" in 2012.
Thirty years later, Silverstone loves the impact “Clueless” has had on audiences.
“People always say Oh you must be so sick of it. But what’s there to be sick of? People liking the movie you’re in? It truly doesn’t get better,” Silverstone told Vogue.
Stacey Dash

Stacey Dash played Dionne, Cher’s best friend, in “Clueless” and in the sitcom spinoff, which aired on ABC from 1996 to 1997. She’s been in movies like “View from the Top,” TV like “CSI” and music videos. From 2014 to 2017, she was a commentator for Fox News.
Dash told Elle the chemistry between all the actors was the real deal. “We all had so much fun together,” Dash said. “What you see on-screen is exactly what happened every day on set.”
Elisa Donovan
Elisa Donovan was Cher's rival Amber Mariens in both "Clueless" and the spinoff. She also had a long-running part on "Sabrina the Teenage Witch."
After she and Alicia Silverstone reprised their "Clueless" roles in a 2023 Super Bowl ad, Donovan reminisced to People.

"It's been such a gift to reconnect with her and just talk about the challenges and the joys of that time, (and) how it is to be a female growing up in this business, and now being parents, and it’s great to see that we all have survived and thrived,” she said.
Jeremy Sisto
Jeremy Sisto has had long-running parts on "Law & Order," "Suburgatory" and "Six Feet Under." He's also been on "FBI" since 2018.

But before all that, he was Elton, a rich kid in "Clueless." Sisto told TV Insider he thought the movie would "do all right" when it was made, but didn't expect massive success. "What did start to happen is people would recognize me from it," he said.
"As future generations become attached to it and it became part of their childhoods as well, it became more of a marvel that I was really excited to be part of," he continued.
Paul Rudd

Paul Rudd has gone on to have a busy career in Hollywood since "Clueless," starring in superhero movies like "Ant-Man" and comedies like "I Love You, Man." He also has a reputation for seemingly never aging.
While on Amy Poehler’s "Good Hang" podcast, Rudd shared that he didn't hear back after his audition for Josh in "Clueless." So, the next time he went to the barber shop, he said, "Just buzz my head."

A week later, he ran into the director Amy Heckerling at a restaurant who panicked when she saw the hairless Rudd. When it came time for the screen test, Rudd told Poehler, "They put in a wig to try and match what my hair used to be.” By the time shooting came around, though, Rudd’s hair had grown back, and he was all set to teach us how to drive.
Brittany Murphy
The late Brittany Murphy played Tai, the transfer student who Cher and Dionne attemp to transform.

In an E! News interview, Murphy guessed what made the movie so popular. “All teenagers are on an ever-constant quest to be older,” Murphy said. “They just want to be accepted as adults so bad, but they’re just not ready yet.”
Before her death, Murphy made an impact in other movies like "Girl, Interrupted," "8 Mile," "Just Married" and "Uptown Girl."
Murphy died in 2009 at the age of 32. She died from pneumonia but anemia and prescription drugs were contributing factors, officials said.
Donald Faison
Donald Faison credited "Clueless" with his nine season run as Dr. Christopher Turk on the hit TV series "Scrubs."
"If it wasn’t for 'Clueless,' I would’ve never gotten 'Scrubs.' I would’ve never gotten anything. 'Clueless' by far is one of my biggest accomplishments," he told People.
Back in 2022, Faison’s daughter channeled his "Clueless "character's on-screen girlfriend, Dionne, for Halloween, wearing a plaid set and rose hat.
Wallace Shawn
As the tough-loving teacher who gives Cher a “C” in debate class at the start of the film, Wallace Shawn appreciated how the movie subverts social norms.

“Even the socially awkward teachers are accepted by the more socially adept teenagers,” Shawn told TODAY. “It’s a very lovely world that (writer-director) Amy Heckerling has created, and people respond very passionately to that.”

Shawn, by then, was already famous for parts in "The Princess Bride" and "My Dinner with Andre," and has made countless memorable pop culture appearances from "Gossip Girl" to "The Incredibles." He is also a playwright and a screenwriter.
Breckin Meyer

Breckin Meyer played a skateboarding high schooler in "Clueless" — and was a skateboarder in real life. Meyer told Steve Kmetko on the podcast "Still Here Hollywood" that he skateboarded to his "Clueless" audition.
“I arrived sweating, greasy, long-haired, gross dude but also kind of fit the part of little skater stoner kid,” Meyer said.
Meyer went on to star in other movies of the late '90s and early aughts like "The Craft," "Road Trip" and "Rat Race," and has been a Hollywood fixture ever since.

title: Will Jonathan Scott and Zooey Deschanel Elope? Here’s What Drew Scott Thinks
summary: Jonathan Scott fills TODAY with Jenna and Friends in on his wedding plans with Zooey Deschanel.
story: Jonathan Scott is used to being asked when he and fiancée Zooey Deschanel are tying the knot — but are the wedding bells for their ears alone?

While promoting the HGTV show “Chasing the West" he's hosting with his brother, set to premiere on July 30, the design expert pondered the question that crosses some couples’ minds while wedding planning: Is it better to elope?
“Zooey and I are having so much fun. And you know, we keep saying, ‘Oh my gosh, oh my gosh, we’ve got to plan a wedding.’ We have not planned it yet,” he tells TODAY.com in a recent interview.
And that’s when the million-dollar question popped up: “Is it better to elope, or is it better to have a grand wedding?”
While Jonathan Scott fished for the answer, Drew Scott said the answer for brother, his senior by four minutes, was crystal clear.
"I know my brother, there's no way he's eloping," he answers.
"Jonathan is the ultimate event planner, and Jonathan and Zooey together are like the ultimate event planners," Drew Scott continues.
Jonathan Scott admits that wedding planning isn't "stressful" for him and his fiancée, as they're "super chill" and like to throw parties.

"Halloween, Christmas ... I purposely don't throw parties because I don't need to, because (Jonathan and Zooey's) parties are so epic. I just invite my friends over there," Drew Scott says with a laugh.
Earlier that morning, basketball icon Dwyane Wade, who was co-hosting TODAY with Jenna & Friends, playfully pressed Jonathan Scott on his wedding plans with the “New Girl” actor.
“Let me just say, there is an idea, a plan in our minds, you will be the first person (to know), I swear,” Jonathan Scott said with a wink to the camera.

The older Property Brother first connected with the “New Girl” actor while filming an episode of “Carpool Karaoke in 2019, and in 2023, he popped the question while they were on a family trip in Scotland.
While the couple has kept wedding plans hush-hush, Jonathan Scott has disclosed that they want to keep the wedding small.

title: Everything to Know About Bowen Yang and Matt Rogers’ Las Culturistas Culture Awards
summary: "Las Culturistas" hosts Bowen Yang and Matt Rogers' awards show took place in Los Angeles July 17. Jamie Lee Curtis, Andy Cohen and more attended. How to watch.
story: Where else could Jenna Bush Hager and bodega guys who call you "boss" be nominated for the same award? The Las Culturistas Culture Awards.

The Las Culturistas Culture Awards celebrate pop culture's most iconic events of the year, with a little bit of nonsense and whimsy too — like Jenna's nomination for the TODAY show award for excellence in the morning.
TODAY viewers may remember the awards show's hosts, "Saturday Night Live" star Bowen Yang and comedian Matt Rogers, as two of Jenna's guest co-hosts on TODAY with Jenna & Friends this year.

Jenna and her former fourth hour co-host, Hoda Kotb, won the award in 2024. This year marks the fourth iteration of the awards show, named after Yang and Rogers' "Las Culturistas" podcast, and will be televised for the first time.
But avid fans of the show and podcast may have noticed photos of Yang, Rogers and plenty of presenters and nominees from the show's red carpet July 17.
Here's what to know about the Las Culturistas Culture Awards and how to watch the show.
What Is 'Las Culturistas'?
"Las Culturistas" is a podcast hosted by Yang and Rogers, where the pair discuss the latest in pop culture, often with a guest.
Yang and Rogers released the first episode of their podcast in 2016 and have had many guests, including Michelle Obama, Lady Gaga and Sarah Jessica Parker.
Most episodes of the podcast begin with the question, “What was the culture that made you say, ‘Culture is for me?’” and move to the guest's "Rules of Culture."

Yang and Rogers close out the show with a segment called "I Don't Think So, Honey," where they, along with their guest, are given 60 seconds to rant about an element of culture that they find annoying or frustrating.
What Are the Las Culturistas Culture Awards?
The Las Culturistas Culture Awards is Yang and Rogers' awards show where they celebrate excellence in culture, with a lot of silliness along the way.

The fourth annual installment of the show is set to have "more than 100 unique award categories," according to a press release. There will also be live musical performances and "unexpected celebrity guests," all while being televised for the first time.
“The word ‘culture’ is defined as ‘the arts and other manifestations of human intellectual achievement regarded collectively,’” Rogers and Yang said in a statement.

“We are so thrilled to eliminate that whole ‘intellectual’ part entirely with the LCCA’s airing on Bravo and Peacock this August, alongside our partners at Lionsgate," the pair added. "Because while what the world needs now might be love sweet love, it also needs to see an Oscar winning actress and a Real Housewife come together to present a very heavy award to Oprah, if we can book her. Oprah, u up?!”

The "Las Culturistas" Instagram account announced the first batch of categories for the 2025 awards show July 1 and featured nominees for awards like hypochondriac award for illness we think we have this time and the secret to life award.
Jenna faces the following contenders in her category: My girl Nanda at the coffee shop that I see each day; Bodega guys that call you "Boss"; sex, at times; and muffin.
Additional categories were announced July 11, including most amazing impact in film, best Batman woman, the Allison Williams cool girl award and many more.
When Are the Las Culturistas Culture Awards?
The show was taped July 17 in Los Angeles, and images and videos from the red carpet quickly hit social media.
Celebrities like Jamie Lee Curtis, Andy Cohen, Kenan Thompson and cast members from "The Real Housewives of Salt Lake City" were spotted on the carpet ahead of the taping.
After the show, Cohen posted about the event on his Instagram, calling it "the most entertaining, funniest award show in a long time."
Where to Watch the Las Culturistas Culture Awards

The Las Culturistas Culture Awards are set to air Tuesday Aug. 5, on Bravo from 9-11 p.m. ET and will be available to stream the next day on Peacock. (Bravo and Peacock are part of TODAY’s parent company, NBCUniversal.)

title: 'Naked Gun' Star on the Enduring Popularity of 'Hey! It’s Enrico Pallazzo!': 'It’s Just Insane'
summary: Actor Mark Holton is sharing his thoughts on the enduring popularity of the famous line "Hey! It's Enrico Pallazzo!" from the 1988 comedy "The Naked Gun."
story: “Hey! It’s Enrico Pallazzo!”
Four words. Three seconds. Too many laughs to count.

That’s the line from “The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad!” uttered toward the end of the classic 1988 movie, after Leslie Nielsen’s bumbling Lt. Frank Drebin thwarted an assassination attempt on Queen Elizabeth II at a California Angels baseball game.

The line is said by a fan in the stands who recognizes Drebin as the man who had sung the national anthem after Drebin knocked out the fictional international opera singer Pallazzo and proceeded to butcher the song while pretending to be him.
